Package dontlookback

Class InputManager

java.lang.Object
dontlookback.InputManager
public class InputManager extends Object
Input Manager for Controller and Keyboard Support Manages input from various sources including keyboards, gamepads, and other controllers. Provides a unified interface for game input handling with configurable mappings. Features: - Multi-controller support - Configurable button mappings - Analog stick and trigger support - Input buffering and timing - Accessibility options
Version:
1.0
Author:
DLB Team

      public float getAxisValue(int axis)
      Get analog axis value with deadzone applied
      Parameters:
      axis - axis constant
      Returns:
      value from -1.0 to 1.0

    • getMovementVector

      public float[] getMovementVector()
      Get movement vector from controller
      Returns:
      float array {x, y} representing movement direction

    • setSensitivity

      public void setSensitivity(float sensitivity)
      Set input sensitivity
      Parameters:
      sensitivity - sensitivity multiplier (0.1 to 2.0)

    • setControllerEnabled

      public void setControllerEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Enable or disable controller input
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable controller

    • setKeyboardEnabled

      public void setKeyboardEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Enable or disable keyboard input
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable keyboard

    • isControllerConnected

      public boolean isControllerConnected()
      Check if any controller is connected
      Returns:
      true if controller available

    • isLookBackTriggered

      public boolean isLookBackTriggered()
      Check if the dangerous "look back" action was triggered This is the core horror mechanic - looking back spawns monsters!
      Returns:
      true if player attempted to look back

    • getDangerWarning

      public String getDangerWarning()
      Get a warning message for dangerous inputs
      Returns:
      warning message or null if safe

Don't Look Back - Horror Survival Game Engine

Built with Java 17, LWJGL 3.3.4, JBox2D | GitHub Repository | Report Issues
